comment: I took his class 4 years ago and HATED him. I always thought I was a great writer, but he destroyed my writing, and I only managed an 80 in that class. HOWEVER, now I'm applying to law school 4 years later, I am SO thankful for him because he teaches you how to write like you have an education by cutting out wordiness and fallacies. Take him.

This class is very difficult. His lectures are confusing because he tends to go off tangents. His quizzes are ridiculous. He's a difficult grader. However, the class teaches how to write like a college student. If you REALLY want to learn, take this class.

Do not take this class. you will regret it the second you walk in. the teacher mumbles and is very hard to understand and he also does not repeat things if you do not understand/hear them the first time. extremely hard grader and quiz giver. i'm a straight A student and I'm struggling to keep a C. the class average is a 70! STAY AWAY NOW!!!!!!!!!!!

Avoid this teacher at all costs if you care about your grade. The highest average in my class was a 70. He was going what our quiz was gonna be on and no one could hear him, so i raised my hand and told him that no one could hear him. He then said "ok" & then went back to his mumbling, it resulted in everyone failing the quiz. He's an awful teacher

This teacher doesn't understand what his job is supposed to be about. He is hard to hear as he walks around the class mumbling. He's unclear about the assignments that he wants his students to perform. He also edited a paper of mine and said it was perfect and to not change a thing and then proceeded to give a a 7/15! He grades based on his opinion

If you enjoy writing, do not take this class. He will take all the joy you once had for it and crush it. I received a 99 in English 1101 and struggled to maintain a B in his course. He was extremely rude and graded based completely on opinion. He is very pompous and talks down to students. Avoid this professor if at all possible!
I would recommend you not take him. He is rude and mean. And it seems he enjoys when people fail. He shouldn?t be a teacher. You will most likely regret taking him.

I dont understand all the negative comments. Prof Robinson was great for 1101 and 1102 and I would recommend him. If you dont show up, pay attention, and actually participate, you will not do well in the class. I took him for both 01 & 02 and did really well for both.

He is a really bad teacher. He is there to 'teach' students, but seems to get kicks from failing them. He grades as if you should be an English professor, not at the freshman/sophomore level which the class is.  Like everyone else has said, I AM an A student in English, but i doubt i will make a B. Please help your self AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS!!!!!

I had him my first semester of college. He was very intimidating.Hated him then. Now I'm in my 5th semester and realize how much he actually taught me. I ended the class with a very low B. I still use a lot of his advice for papers. Do what he asks and don't write the papers the night before (like I did) and an A is definitely in reach!

Hes rude & intimidating. Last day you find out he was just trying to scare you. He does not always explain directions fully. You dont write any long papers but he grades each paper extremely hard. Will try to get you for plagiarism even when you didnt do it. getting a good grade is possible but you have to work really. STUDY FOR ALL TESTS!
Worst teacher I've ever had!!! I've been a straight A student for some time now and I almost failed this class. Steer clear if you want to have a good GPA!
A's are virtually impossible. I am a very good writer and have been my whole life. I got a B. He is very hard to understand and does not ever give clear instructions. Avoid at all costs.

He is not that bad. At first I thought the class was going to be horrible, because he talks so low. However; he is a funny guy and not too bad. I must admit he grades strictly, but he is fair about it. He lets you know what he expects and if you do not agree with his standards he will offer you the opportunity to change it. His class is passable, b
Horrible teacher. He doesn't explain directions clearly. He mumbles when he talks so, its hard to hear him. His quizzes are hard.

Worst professor at Kennesaw and I'm an A student. I read the ratings and ignored the advice because I usually do well regardless. Not this time, I highly recommend avoiding his class even if no other class is available. Learn from my mistake and the mistakes of others before me. Hopefully he's been fired by now but if not PLEASE SAVE YOURSELF/GPA!!

The worst professor imaginable. He is a very strict grader and provides little help. The only time he ever helped was after you turned in your portfolio. Dont take him.. Ever. Even if his class is the only one open. Dont.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! He assigns lots of assignments which he does not give clear instructions. Then he grades them strictly and provides no explanation for the deducted points...He promised my class that if we worked hard and came to class he ensured us a "C". I worked my butt off...My grade was a 69.4 and he would not bump it...RUN!
He didn't help improve my essays. I had a B in his class and at the end when he evaluated my papers, he decides to fail me when I didn't pass the regent's. Rude!

If you want to fail, go ahead and take this class. Worst teacher on kennesaw campus. He gives low grades and has no real reasaon for it. he beats around the bush a lot. HONESTLY, DO NOT TAKE HIM. NO MATTER HOW DESPERATELY U NEED THE CLASS. AVOID HIM. He is rude and does not care about students. A word to the wise is sufficient.

RUN! Pick another class asap, stay away from his class! He completely sucks, doesn't teach, there is not logic in his madness and honestly I'm not even sure why he hasn't been fired by now. Take anyone else but him if you want to pass.

Very hard teacher. Grades differently on each assignment and student. The quizzes are key to passing the class. Going to the writing lab is imperative. Learn what a logical fallacy is before the class. Plagiarism is going to get reported to school board. Don't do it even on accident no forgiveness. Have a passion about writing to take this class.

Robinson's grading is ridiculous. He will tell you that your idea in a paper is wrong and deduct points from it. I took 2 AP English classes in high school and B's in both. I'm am struggling to pass the class. Essay topics are difficult to write on. Definite don't take.

Mr. Robinson is the worst professor in the entire world. I have always made A's in my English classes, but I'll be lucky if I pass his class. He grades extremely harshly and is not afraid to fail students. On the first day of class he told us he's made students cry before. He's not lying either.
horrible teacher. mumbles and rants and is rude. worst teacher period

Do not take this professor if at all possible. I try to see the good in people...so I think he is a nice man, but not made for teaching. Confusing, irrational, rude, etc. Willing to talk with you about grades, but laughs at you when you try to correct him. I do not recommend him, good luck if you can't get out.

This professor isn't really all that bad like everyone has been saying.The class itself is easy.All you have to do is study for the quizzes and make sure you revise your essay very well before turning them in.I am not a very good student in English but,I managed to get a B+ after slacking off the first couple of quizzes and essays.So don't be scare

AVOID OR DIE!!! He is the worst! He always tell you what's wrong with your paper but not how to fix it. His directions are very vague, yet he grades very harshly. He's so strict and harsh that even the writing center can't help me. Every time I go in there all I do is confuse them with all the rules he gives. Do NOT take him, good writer or not.

HE IS VERY VAGUE. HE SHOWS TERRIBLE FAVORITISM TOWARD THOSE WHO SHOW THEY CAN REALLY WRITE FROM THE START OF THE CLASS. HE GRADES HARSHLY AND DOESNT GIVE EXPLANATIONS FOR WHY HE IS TAKING POINTS OFF. DONT EMAIL HIM BECAUSE YOU WILL GET A VAGUE IGNORANT ONE WORD "ANSWER". I'M A EXCELLENT ENGLISH STUDENT AND BARELY MADE IT OUT..AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

This professor is really hard if you don't put in time for this class.  I took 4 classes and most of my time was spent doing things for this class.  All of the information is on WebCT and he gives helpful websites.  He is funny sometimes.. but gets off topic alot.  I made an A in his class but i definately had to work for it!

He does not teach clearly. He frequently gets off subject. I am a good writer according to my SAT, but this class is just impossible. He doesn't explain what he wants "write a narrative" that's it. yet he grades meticulously. Lots of people withdrew from my class. I highly recommend a different professor.
He is one of the worst professors I've had as a student at Kennesaw so far. He is not a good teacher at all, and he has favorites. DO NOT take this class.

not very helpful marks off for small things, if you put flower and it was a plant he marks the whole question wrong  would HIGHLY recommend someone else a LOT of reading in his class if English is not your strong point take some one else

Professor Robinson is almost impossible...im a great writer, my score on the SAT proves that, but he grade so meticulously on the essays he gives us to write... he also demands that you not show up late even tho he does all the time. fell asleep in class alot because hes boring. DONT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR

I'm a good writer, so i did well in this class. His quizes are hard and if the definition is not exactly out of the book, it's wrong - and even then, it's still wrong sometimes. Majority of the grade is writings, so if you're a good writer, you'll do fine; if not, don't take him. He's really funny if you listen to him, boring if not. i loved him :)
Doesnt really teach much, likes to just make you look in the book.  Essays and quizzes are hard.  And, he is boring.

Insanely difficult. Very unclear about what he wanted. Attendance policy is a little more than insane--wouldn't take a hospital note. I'd advise finding another professor if you have other classes and/or a job, because the workload is heavier than most classes. And that's just being nice. Long story short--find another professor at any cost.

The first day of class he expected us to print something out in class and have money on our ID cards. He made us do in class quizzes online on WebCT Vista. He expected us to have assignments ready without even giving us due dates. Everything is either his way or no way. Avoid taking a class with him at all costs.
lets just say he hasnt changed one bit since 2003! Do NOT take this professor!!!

There are a lot of people who do not like this professor but I did not have a huge problem with him. He does require you to do the work yourself and he expects everyone to try their hardest. If you are not lazy and will actually do the work, you'll do fine. However, I ended the class with an 89 and he did not even consider bumping me up.
very vague and does not give study guides for tests.

He is an excellent teacher. All other students who wrote on this wall are extremely dramatic and apparently very stupid and LAZY!!! He is a little strict but as long as you do your work on time, you will be more than fine!
He is vague. He mumbles and goes off on tangents during the lecture.
very vague

I will admit Professor Robinson was hard. Day one he explains his expectations of all students, so if you pay attention to his expectations you will be OK with the class.  I will also say that this is a class that you will have to actually do the work on your ownm he will not do the work for you.  He also tends to trail off while talking.

Worse teacher ever!!!  Do Not Take him. He barely teaches and tests are extremely hard. He brags about his class GPA being a C-. I'm an english major and i've never had problems with english until now. His attendence policy is impossible.  And he only grades structure on papers, not the actual paper itself.
HORRIBLE! you can try your best and he will accuse you of plagarism for silly little things. Dont take this teacher. He mumbles, does not teach, and is extremely overly strict.
EXTREMELY STRICT!!!

Robionson is HORRIBLE!! He tried to accuse four people in my class of plagiarism for silly little mistakes (like citing incorrectly). He never answered my questions clearly and overall he was just rude. Stear clear of this guy!
He was very unclear with directions, and very strict. He was not helpful, and if you want an easy A do NOT take him. Avoid this teacher if possible.
very hard, but still managed a B. very helpful in future classes

This is a difficult class! It's very boring because he rambles on and on. It requires lots of work too. You have to read pretty much the entire textbook, there's a 10-page research paper, plus 2 in-class essays, 3 other essays, and about 4 tests. He is VERY picky when it comes to papers and tests.

J. Robinson is a great teacher.  He expects a lot out of his students, but he can really improve your writing.  He is ALWAYS ready to answer your questions.  He's pretty fussy about the details and isn't very clear on what he wants, but if you just ask questions, he usually explains himself until you understand. Keep on the reading and assignments.

Very good class. Best teacher I have ever taken. Yes, he is demanding, but if you keep up with the work it's not bad at all. I have found his course extraordinarily helpful in all my other classes and get A's in all of them. If you just want to slack off though, this is not the teacher for you. He has no patience for laziness.
very picky and hard teacher. Avoid him!!

Mr. Robinson is a unique man.  You HAVE to go to class, and you HAVE to study, and at least read sparknotes before the tests.  Tests are kinda tricky and he is VERY picky on papers.  You can still get a decent grade, but you have to try.

this man is a menace. he doesnt care about english. he cares about whether or not you've turned in your arbitrary assigned essay in to turnitin.com by some arbitrary time. which, by the way, if you dont, will constitute an entire letter grade off the assigment even if he's had a hard copy for weeks. NOT recommended.
DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!

True he does babble, and, he is very picky. All his essays come from a grammer book which he expects you to read as if it's a novel. However he's a pretty nice guy. I wouldn't recomend any student who did not have any good english teachers during his/her previous education. He will eat you alive.

Mr.Robinson is like every other ENGL teacher....he helps out, teaches, but also wants you to learn SOMETHING by taking his class. HE has multiple IMPROMPTU essays, in-class essays, and papers-final RESEARCH paper due at end of sem, FaiRLY EasY though....Great Personality and always willing to help.......

The class is demanding.  He is very picky, but for valid reasons.  He sticks to his guns. If you are willing to learn, you will benifit greatly from this class.  He is very nice and also very serious about is profession.  I recommend him if you really want to understand academic writing.
No Comments

very confusing, doesn't exactly teach...more like babbles on about, well i'm not exactly sure what about. nice guy, just very hard to learn anything from. tests are all essay questions and 2 research papers plus an attendence policy. would not recommend.
No Comments

Avoid this teacher like a plague!!!! So boring, so unclear, assigns so much work that it is impossible to finish if you plan on taking any other classes or have a job. His goal is to see his students fail and is sell procliamed as a difficult teacher. He is also very unorganized and not all that educated in this field and will not answer questions.
A very fair teacher.He teaches you how to write. His impromptu essays helps prepare one for the Regent's test. It is not a show up and pass class.

He is a more challenging teacher than some would expect which is probably why some don't like him.  He is a nice guy if you give it your best and ask questions!  If you want a free ride, it isn't the class for you, but is the most beneficial engl class.

He just needs students to babble to. There's no point in attending class except that he has a attendance policy- no more than 5 absences (or you fail). Very unclear, i.e. he says you're never allowed to use first person in a narrative... NEVER.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
The professor does give a lot of essays and 4 in class impromptus, but he prepares students for the next class.  His class is not hard, you just have to do the work.

DUDE I couldnt understand anything he says!!!! but! he does try to help you but when you ask a question he goes on about WHO KNOWS WHAT for like an hour and you have no clue what he said.. I would recommend someone else
